channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI doesn’t fail on tech—it fails on leadership
item.description: Moving beyond the AI hype cycle toward the autonomous enterprise starts with intentional leadership.

item.title: How an Unlikely Brand Is Appearing Alongside Ralph Lauren at the Olympics
item.description: Figs co-founder and CEO Trina Spear explains how the company ‘leveled up’ its scrubs for Alpine conditions.

item.title: Devastating Hurricane Melissa is sweeping through the Caribbean. Here’s how to help
item.description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica on Tuesday as a devastating Category 5 storm , tied for the strongest landfalling Atlantic hurricane in his...

item.title: How to Dominate the Next Social Platform, According to Duolingo’s Playbook
item.description: The language-learning app moves fast to build a loyal audience.

item.title: Inside the Superhuman effort to rebrand Grammarly
item.description: It’s rare for a company to give up more than a decade of brand recognizability for a new name. It’s even rarer for said company to trade their name fo...

item.title: HKEX CEO Bonnie Chan says global stock exchanges have to work together to stay relevant in a crypto age
item.description: "We're entering a stage where exchanges are not really competing with one another, but working together," HKEX CEO Bonnie Chan said.

item.title: Chanel’s CEO went to Microsoft HQ and asked ChatGPT to show her a picture of her company’s leadership. They were all men in suits
item.description: Leena Nair said more than 75% of her company’s employees are female.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Grokipedia goes live in a bid to compete with crowdsourced Wikipedia
item.description: Elon Musk has launched Grokipedia, a crowdsourced online encyclopedia that the billionaire seeks to position as a rival to Wikipedia . Writing on soci...

item.title: 7 Networking Mistakes That Undermine Your Professional Success
item.description: Your network is a crucial asset, but these habits can kill it.

item.title: UPS CFO on Amazon pullback and driving a growth strategy
item.description: Brian Dykes explains why UPS is prioritizing profitability over volume, and how refocusing its network is delivering results.

item.title: Nvidia is officially the world’s first $5 trillion company. CEO Jensen Huang says it’s on track for ‘half a trillion dollars’ in revenue
item.description: Nvidia reached the $5 trillion threshold just three months after becoming the first company to hit $4 trillion.

item.title: As Russia Tests NATO’s Limits, Estonia’s Tech Scene Heats Up
item.description: Estonia’s tech sector is adapting fast to the risks of Russian incursions into NATO countries.

item.title: Starbucks is broken, but can it be fixed? A look at the future of the coffee giant
item.description: Starbucks’s reign as the world’s leading coffee company is faltering. And the new CEO, Brian Niccol, wants to fix it. Mark Wilson explains.

item.title: Palantir stock-split chatter swells as earnings date nears: Will it happen?
item.description: Rumor has it that Palantir Technologies is poised for a stock split. An analyst for RBC Capital Markets recently polled investors, who reportedly indi...

item.title: Job Hugging Replaced Quiet Quitting, but it Won’t Last. Here’s How to Retain Talent
item.description: New data shows 75 percent of employees plan on staying in their jobs for two more years amid anemic hiring trends. When the labor market opens up, her...
